thread.title: Vegan cyclist unleashes foul-mouthed tirade at driver
thread.title_full: Vegan cyclist unleashes foul-mouthed tirade at driver | Daily Mail Online

author: Nic White For Daily Mail Australia
title: Vegan cyclist unleashes foul-mouthed tirade at driver
text:
An angry cyclist unleashed an expletive-laden rant at a driver he claimed passed too close to him on a narrow road.
Harley Johnstone, known as Durianrider on YouTube , accused the motorist of 'trying to kill him' and raged against dangerous drivers in two-minute tirade.
It started after he and two friends were riding up Norton Summit in Adelaide on Sunday when the white Alpina sedan passed them, before pulling over ahead.
Angry cyclist Harley 'Durianrider' Johnstone (L) unleashed an expletive-laden rant at a driver he accused of 'trying to kill him' by passing too close to him on a narrow road
Mr Johnstone, sporting a lycra jersey and shorts saying 'go vegan', stopped and grabbed at the car's door handle, opening it slightly before the driver pulled it shut.
'F**king car, you want to kill me mate, you want to kill me? I'm here, kill me, man!' he yelled while angrily gesturing with his arms.
Mr Johnstone's friend told the driver he passed him by 'less than a foot, it was withing touching distance' and threatened to report him to police.
After an initial burst of anger, the driver attempts to diffuse the situation, asking the irate cyclist: 'Chill man, why are you so upset?'
He and two friends were riding up Norton Summit in Adelaide on Sunday when the white Alpina sedan passed them (pictured)
Mr Johnstone, sporting a lycra jersey and shorts saying 'go vegan', stopped grabbed at the car's door handle, opening it slightly before the driver pulled it shut
'Because my f**king mate got killed in the city by a f**king car driver like you, he f**king hit his head, man,' Mr Johnstone replied, shouting.
'Every f**king day car drivers come too close, one day someone's gonna f**king kill me. If you want to kill me, I'm f**king here, bro.'
The driver calmly told him to settle down before Mr Johnstone admitted that would take a few minutes.
'I realise that, but you've got to realise that I drive safe around bike riders, I slow right down. You've got too much adrenaline running,' he said.
After an awkward silence of about 10 seconds, the driver warned: 'Settle down, because one day someone is going to f**king clock you'.
'F**king car, you want to kill me mate, you want to kill me? I'm here, kill me, man!' he yelled while angrily gesturing with his arms
The Alpina driver eventually had enough and drove off, leaving the cyclists standing around
Mr Johnstone's reply could not be heard as a gust of wind muffled the microphone, but he made motions like he he was ready to take on all comers.
'You want to go to jail?' the motorist inquired.
'I've already been to jail, bro, I ain't afraid of going back... I ain't afraid to die, man, but I don't wanna die,' Mr Johnstone replied.
With that, the Alpina driver had enough and drove off, leaving the cyclists standing around.
Mr Johnstone's claim to fame is that he dated vegan lifestyle blogger Leanne Ratcliffe, better known as Freelee the Banana Girl, who credits her toned physique to a diet of 51 bananas a day
The pair discussing their vegan lifestyle when they were still together
Mr Johnstone's claim to fame is that he dated vegan lifestyle blogger Leanne Ratcliffe, better known as Freelee the Banana Girl, who credits her toned physique to a diet of 51 bananas a day.
The third member of the team, Gruffudd Pugh-Jones, uploaded his helmet cam video of the encounter to YouTube, blaming the driver for driving too close.
The video quickly went viral online with most viewers defending the driver and pointing out there was another rider on the other side of the road, leaving him little room.
